meanings.definition: The act or process of forming into a ball or mass.
meanings.sent1: The conglobation of dough into a perfect round shape was impressive.
meanings.sent2: She found a conglobation of socks under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The conglobation of snowballs in the yard made the kids excited for a snowball fight.
meanings.sent4: The conglobation of ideas in his mind led to a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The conglobation of colorful balloons created a festive atmosphere at the party.

meanings.sent1: The artist sculpted a conglobation of clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The conglobation of marbles rolled across the floor.
meanings.sent3: The conglobation of fruits in the basket looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The conglobation of stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The conglobation of clouds above us resembled fluffy cotton candy.
